subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests (was: TestNG 4 and Data Providers)
msgSnippet: ... There is no run() on a test class. You mean it invokes run() on the TestRunner, which in turn recreates the test class and invokes the test method on it...
messageBody:
On 10/18/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
>
> On 10/19/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> > > It's not hard to do if you keep the test instance in JUnit. You simply
> > > tell it to run again. With TestNG, you need to reconstruct the test.
> >
> > JUnit will also reconstruct the test, not sure what you are getting at?
>
> Cedric, it does not recreate the test instance... it simply calls the
> run() method on the instance it already has.


There is no run() on a test class.

You mean it invokes run() on the TestRunner, which in turn recreates the
test class and invokes the test method on it...

Which is exactly what TestNG does.

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
